title_sort: walt whitman to thomas jefferson whitman, 15 september [1886]
title: Walt Whitman to Thomas Jefferson Whitman, 15 September [1886]
text: CamdenSept 15 noonLou got home last night all safe—She & George came here ab'tabout 10 last night—She told me many little particulars I was glad to hear, though all is so sad—Nothing special in my affairs—I am writing some—have just sent off a piece to Harpers—(they may take it, & may not)—I have written a piece ab'tabout "War Hospitals" for the Century—which they have taken & paid me for—(Both mag's pay handsomely)—I send you & Jess a letter just rec'dreceived from Hannah—We have had several inquiries here about dear Hattie's death—two ladies call'dcalled yesterday who had seen Hattie here at Lou's. Love to you, dear brother—Love to you, Jessie dear—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Thomas Jefferson Whitman, 15 September [1886]
